name: Periciazine
summary: Periciazine is a typical antipsychotic medication primarily used to manage schizophrenia and severe behavioral disturbances.
description: Periciazine is a piperidine phenothiazine derivative with antipsychotic and sedative properties. It works mainly by blocking dopamine D2 receptors in the brain, thereby reducing psychotic symptoms and excessive behavioral activity. It also exhibits alpha-adrenergic and anticholinergic blocking effects. It is indicated for the treatment of schizophrenia, other psychoses, and severe agitation or aggression in patients with mental illness or intellectual disability.

off_label_uses: Adjunct for severe anxiety in resistant cases
contraindications: CNS depression from alcohol or other depressants

items: Control of severe agitation and aggression in psychiatric and developmental disorders

sections.text: Periciazine acts as a dopamine D2 receptor antagonist, reducing the positive symptoms of psychosis. It also has antihistaminic, anticholinergic, and alpha-adrenergic blocking activity, contributing to its sedative effects.

adult.Psychosis: Typical dose: 15–30 mg/day in divided doses; may be adjusted based on clinical response.

sections.pediatric: For severe behavioral disorders: start at 0.1–0.2 mg/kg/day in divided doses; titrate cautiously.
sections.geriatric: Start with lower doses due to increased sensitivity and comorbidities.

sections.text: Sedative effects may occur within hours; antipsychotic effects may take several days to weeks.

sections.black_box: Elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis treated with antipsychotic drugs are at an increased risk of death.
other: Risk of extrapyramidal symptoms, especially with higher doses or long-term use
Avoid abrupt withdrawal to prevent rebound symptoms

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks; may cause neonatal withdrawal symptoms if used in late pregnancy.
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; avoid or monitor infant closely.
sections.pediatrics: Approved for behavioral disturbances in some regions; monitor growth and development.

sections.text: Gradual dose reduction recommended to prevent withdrawal symptoms and relapse.

items: Older typical antipsychotic with strong sedative properties
Primarily used when sedation is desired alongside antipsychotic effects
Less commonly prescribed today due to availability of atypical antipsychotics
